Data Preprocessing¶

Trodes Data¶

Here we go over a collection of modules for extracting, reading, parsing and preprocessing trodes data produced by various ReachMaster routines.

Extract trodes data to python¶

SpikeGadgets provides this script to import data from Trodes to Python. For further documentation, visit SpikeGadgets .

trodes_data.readTrodesExtractedDataFile3.readTrodesExtractedDataFile(filename)[source]¶

Read a DIO or analog Trodes .dat file. These files are typically produced after converting the raw .rec files using the exportdio or exportanalog bash scripts provided by SpikeGadgets. Visit SpikeGadgets for more details.

Parameters:filename (str) – Path to file
Returns:fieldText – A nested dictionary with the extracted data
Return type:dict

Calibration data parser¶

A library for reading, parsing, and preprocessing trodes data collected during robot calibration routines.

trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.get_calibration_frame(data_dir, trodes_name, sampling_rate=3000, valve_period=0.175, pot_units='cm')[source]¶

Generate a data frame that can be used to estimate calibration parameters.

Parameters:
  • data_dir (str) – Parent directory where the trodes data lives
  • trodes_name (str) – Name of original .rec trodes file
  • sampling_rate (int) – Specifying a rate (Hz) lower than the SpikeGadgets MCU clock rate of 30 kHz will downsample the data and speed up the parsing.
  • valve_period (float) – Time (sec) between valve command onsets
  • pot_units (str) – Units to return potentiometer recordings. Can be cm, volts, or bits.
Returns:

data_frame – A pandas data frame with columns onset_time, x_position, x_duration, x_displacement, y_position, y_duration, y_displacement, z_position, z_duration, and z_displacement.
Return type:

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame
trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.get_trodes_files(data_dir, trodes_name)[source]¶

Generate names of all the trodes files from a calibration recording. Assumes data is saved in the default trodes filesystem and channels are named appropriately in the trodes configuration file.

Parameters:
  • data_dir (str) – Parent directory where the trodes data lives
  • trodes_name (str) – Name of original .rec trodes file
Returns:

trodes_files – The file names for each channel of a calibration recording. More specifically, x_push_file is the *.dat file for the x actuator push valve command recording. Similarly, y_pot_file is the *.dat for the y actuator poteniometer recording.
Return type:

dict
trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.get_valve_transitions(calibration_data)[source]¶

Get the valve start and stop times.

Parameters:calibration_data (dict) – All of the digital (DIO) and analog data corresponding to the trodes files for the a calibration recording. For example, as returned by read_data().
Returns:
  • start_times (dict) – Times at which each of the valves transitioned from closed to open
  • stop_times (dict) – Times at which each of the valves transitioned from open to closed
trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.pots_to_bits(calibration_data, supply_voltage=3.3, controller_max_bits=1023)[source]¶

Convert the potentiometer data units to microcontroller bits.

Parameters:
  • calibration_data (dict) – All of the digital (DIO) and analog data corresponding to the trodes files for the a calibration recording. For example, as returned by read_data().
  • supply_voltage (float) – Maximum voltage for the potentiometers
  • controller_max_bits (int) – Maximum bits for the microcontroller
Returns:

calibration_data – Calibration data with potentiometer data convert to microcontroller bits
Return type:

dict
trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.pots_to_cm(calibration_data, supply_voltage=3.3, pot_range=5.0)[source]¶

Convert the potentiometer data units to cm.

Parameters:
  • calibration_data (dict) – All of the digital (DIO) and analog data corresponding to the trodes files for the a calibration recording. For example, as returned by read_data().
  • supply_voltage (float) – Maximum voltage for the potentiometers
  • pot_range (float) – Potentiometer maximum travel range in cm
Returns:

calibration_data – Calibration data with potentiometer data convert to cm
Return type:

dict
trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.pots_to_volts(calibration_data)[source]¶

Convert the potentiometer data units to volts.

Parameters:calibration_data (dict) – All of the digital (DIO) and analog data corresponding to the trodes files for the a calibration recording. For example, as returned by read_data().
Returns:calibration_data – Calibration data with potentiometer data convert to volts
Return type:dict
trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.read_data(trodes_files, sampling_rate=3000)[source]¶

Read all the trodes file data using the SpikeGadgets readTrodesExtractedDataFile script.

Parameters:
  • trodes_files (dict) – The file names for each channel of a calibration recording. For example, as returned by get_trodes_files().
  • sampling_rate (int) – Specifying a rate (Hz) lower than the SpikeGadgets MCU clock rate of 30 kHz will downsample the data and speed up the parsing.
Returns:

calibration_data – All of the digital (DIO) and analog data corresponding to the trodes files for the a calibration recording.
Return type:

dict
trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.to_numpy(calibration_data)[source]¶

Convert the calibration data to numpy arrays

Parameters:calibration_data (dict) – All of the digital (DIO) and analog data corresponding to the trodes files for the a calibration recording. For example, as returned by read_data().
Returns:calibration_data – Numpy-converted calibration data.
Return type:dict
trodes_data.calibration_data_parser.to_seconds(calibration_data, start_at_zero=True)[source]¶

Convert the calibration data time units to seconds.

Parameters:
  • calibration_data (dict) – All of the digital (DIO) and analog data corresponding to the trodes files for the a calibration recording. For example, as returned by read_data().
  • start_at_zero (bool) – If True, the start time will be set to 0.
Returns:

calibration_data – Seconds-converted calibration data
Return type:

dict
